case_name_full: The People of the State of New York, Respondent, v. William Cain, Appellant
headmatter:
<parties id="AEy">
    The People of the State of New York, Respondent, v William Cain, Appellant.
   </parties><citation id="ACn">
    [6 NYS3d 484]
   </citation>

opinions.opinion_text:
People v Cain (2015 NY Slip Op 03939)





People v Cain


2015 NY Slip Op 03939


Decided on May 7, 2015


Appellate Division, First Department



Published by New York State Law Reporting Bureau pursuant to Judiciary Law § 431.


This opinion is uncorrected and subject to revision before publication in the Official Reports.



Decided on May 7, 2015

Friedman, J.P., Acosta, Richter, Gische, JJ.


15042 1456/11

[*1] The People of the State of New York, Respondent, —
vWilliam Cain, Defendant-Appellant.


Robert S. Dean, Center for Appellate Litigation, New York (Lauren Springer of counsel), for appellant.
Robert T. Johnson, District Attorney, Bronx (David P. Johnson of counsel), for respondent.



Judgment, Supreme Court, Bronx County (Michael A. Gross, J.), rendered February 27, 2014, convicting defendant, upon his plea of guilty, of manslaughter in the first degree, and sentencing him to a term of 22 ½ years, unanimously affirmed.
Although we do not find that defendant made a valid waiver of the right to appeal, we perceive no basis for reducing the sentence.
THIS CONSTITUTES THE DECISION AND ORDER
OF THE SUPREME COURT, APPELLATE DIVISION, FIRST DEPARTMENT.
ENTERED: MAY 7, 2015
CLERK

court_short_name: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of New York
